headline.main: An Antidote to Overdose, in Time to Save Lives

docs.abstract: A lifesaving drug is starting to reach people who can use it promptly.
docs.snippet: A lifesaving drug is starting to reach people who can use it promptly.

docs.lead_paragraph: Former NFL lineman Jeremy Newberry often hobbled into the 49ers locker room on game days using a walking boot and crutches, then lined up behind as many as two dozen teammates, in his case to get a shot of the painkiller Toradol in the butt. Ten minutes later, he sprinted out of the tunnel and onto the field.

headline.main: Ex-Players Say Teams Gave Pain Pills 'Like Candy'
headline.print_headline: Ex-Players Say Teams Gave Pain Pills 'Like Candy'

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court issued a new stay on Wednesday to halt the execution of a Missouri death row inmate because his lawyers say he suffers from a rare health condition that could lead to undue suffering from a lethal injection.

headline.main: Supreme Court Stays Missouri Death Row Inmate's Execution
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Stays Missouri Death Row Inmate's Execution

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court issued a new stay on Wednesday to halt the execution of a Missouri death row inmate because his lawyers say he suffers from a rare health condition that could lead to undue suffering from a lethal injection.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers found that smokers were more likely to quit if they used electronic cigarettes rather than therapies like nicotine patches or gum.

headline.main: Study Gives E-Cigarettes Edge in Helping Smokers Quit
headline.print_headline: Study Gives E-Cigarettes Edge in Helping Smokers Quit

docs.abstract: Study published in journal Addiction finds that smokers trying to quit are substantially more likely to succeed if they use electronic cigarettes than over-the-counter therapies; results offer encouraging but not definitive evidence in contentious debate about the increasingly popular smoking devices.
docs.snippet: Researchers found that smokers were more likely to quit if they used electronic cigarettes rather than therapies like nicotine patches or gum.

docs.lead_paragraph: Opening another legal attack on the NFL over the long-term health of its athletes, a group of retired players accused the league in a lawsuit Tuesday of cynically supplying them with powerful painkillers and other drugs that kept them in the game but led to serious complications later in life.

headline.main: Ex-Players Sue NFL Over Use of Painkillers
headline.print_headline: Ex-Players Sue NFL Over Use of Painkillers

headline.main: The Curious Incident of Pfizer's 'Final' Offer for AstraZeneca

docs.abstract: Britain does not have as many takeover defenses as the United States, so it is puzzling why Pfizer did not make a full-fledged hostile bid for AstraZeneca.
docs.snippet: Britain does not have as many takeover defenses as the United States, so it is puzzling why Pfizer did not make a full-fledged hostile bid for AstraZeneca.

docs.abstract: Donald G. McNeil Jr. responds to reader questions about new recommendations to prevent H.I.V. infection with daily doses of the drug Truvada.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal health officials are lowering the starting dose of the popular sleeping aid drug Lunesta, due to risks of morning drowsiness that can impair driving ability and lead to injury.

headline.main: FDA Lowers Lunesta Dose Due to Next-Day Drowsiness
headline.print_headline: FDA Lowers Lunesta Dose Due to Next-Day Drowsiness

docs.snippet: Federal health officials are lowering the starting dose of the popular sleeping aid drug Lunesta, due to risks of morning drowsiness that can impair driving ability and lead to injury.
